name: The girl with the cup.
description:
Malnutrition and poor health are common issues in the slums. The child appears to be suffering from kwashiorkor, a protruding belly being one of the easily recognisable signs. It is a form of malnutrition caused by a lack of protein in ones diet.

The Girl with the cup, 2011, Photography, 76x51cm, Black and White Durst Lambda Print on ILFORD archival paper, Limited edition of 20

name: Pika Chips
description:
Woman selling fried chips on the street in Kibera. In Kenya, most of these women, who might be referred to as the matriarchs of modern Africa, are the backbone the slums. They bear the burden of all survival-related labour.

Pika Chips, 2011, Photography, 76x51cm, Black and White Durst Lambda Print on ILFORD archival paper, Limited edition of 20

name: Just JIK it!
description:
Men relaxing after work. They are leaning on a Black Mamba, the everyday workhorse bicycle mostly used in Nairobi to carry heavy weights, second only to the mkokoteni and hand drawn cart.

Just JIK it!, 2011, Photography, 76x51cm, Black and White Durst Lambda Print on ILFORD archival paper, Limited edition of 20

name: Fundi Wa Viatu (The Shoemaker)
description:
Shoe maker, or rather shoe repairer in Umoja. Shoes are pricy parts of people wear. Usually people will be exhausting all attempts at repairing a pair off shoe before they buy a new one. Repairs range from fixing a hole, patching up the leather, to putting a new sole. The shoe maker resolves much of the problems using strong string from car tyres, a customised sewing needle, patches of leather and strong glue. They have been in service from around the early 70s to present day.

Selected for Foto8 - Summershow 2011 - In show now until 12th August 2011 at the Host Gallery London

Fundi Wa Viatu (The Shoemaker), 2011, Photography, 76x51cm, Black and White Durst Lambda Print on ILFORD archival paper, Limited edition of 20

name: Squatted Car
description:
Mum with her child squatting a wrecked car in Umoja.

Winner of the Hoppe Street Portraits competition at the National Portrait Gallery - in show at the NPG until 30th May 2011

www.npg.org.uk:8080/hoppe/flickr_new.html

Squatted Car, 2011, Photography, 76x51cm, Black and White Durst Lambda Print on ILFORD archival paper, Limited edition of 20
